bibl.title: Leiffman v. Stein. Proclamaiton Form
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: BY THE GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF TEXAS.
TO ALL TO WHOM THESE PRESENTS SHALL COME:

WHEREAS, It has been made known to me, that on the 10th day of June 1877 in the County of Shacked J. Wallack did commit the crime of "forgery" and that said P.J. Wallack is now at large and a fugitive from justice:

Now, Therefore, O.M. Roberts GOVERNOR OF TEXAS, do, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of this State, hereby offer a REWARD OF Fie Hundred DOLLARS .... for the arrest and delivery of the said J. Wallack to the Sheriff of Shackford County, inside the jail door of said County
In Testimony Whereof, I have hereto signed my name and caused the Seal of State to be affixed, at the CITY OF AUSTIN, this 7th day of February A.D. 1880
BY THE GOVERNOR: John D. Templeton Secretary of State
